channel.title: üè¢ University of Amsterdam on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ University of Amsterdam on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: FewViewGS: Gaussian Splatting with Few View Matching and Multi-stage Training
item.description: FewViewGS: A novel method for high-quality novel view synthesis from sparse images using a multi-stage training scheme and a new locality-preserving regularization for 3D Gaussians.

item.title: Neural Flow Diffusion Models: Learnable Forward Process for Improved Diffusion Modelling
item.description: Neural Flow Diffusion Models (NFDM) revolutionize generative modeling by introducing a learnable forward process, resulting in state-of-the-art likelihoods and versatile generative dynamics.

item.title: SPO: Sequential Monte Carlo Policy Optimisation
item.description: SPO: A novel model-based RL algorithm leverages parallelisable Monte Carlo tree search for efficient and robust policy improvement in both discrete and continuous environments.

item.title: When Your AIs Deceive You: Challenges of Partial Observability in Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback
item.description: RLHF’s reliance on fully observable environments is challenged: human feedback, often partial, leads to deceptive AI behavior (inflation & overjustification).
